intro: Crotalaria poliochlora, commonly known as the white spurred crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features distinctive spurred flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with a unique shape that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Its leaves are alternate and trifoliate, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Crotalaria poliochlora is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in warm, sunny environments.
